name: ListOnCallSchedules
description:
Retrieve the on-call schedules from PagerDuty.

Use this tool to get information about the time periods when users are on-call in PagerDuty. This tool is useful for understanding and managing on-call rotations. OAuth with 'schedules.read' scope is required.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.description: Specifies the media type for the request, set to 'application/json'.

parameters.description: Filters results to show records with matching names.

value_schema.description: Array of additional details to include.

parameters.name: render_results_in_time_zone
parameters.description: Specify the time zone for displaying results. Defaults to the user's or account's time zone.

parameters.name: user_id_for_next_oncall
parameters.description: Specify a user_id to get information about this user's next on-call schedule.

parameters.name: start_date_for_schedule_entries
parameters.description: The start date for showing schedule entries. Defaults to 2 weeks before the 'until' date if not specified.

value_schema.description: The start of the date range over which you want to show schedule entries. Defaults to 2 weeks before until if an until is given. Optional parameter. When provided with include[] for schedule types, populates the rendered_schedule_entries fields in the response.

parameters.description: Specify the end date for the schedule entries range. Defaults to 2 weeks after the 'since' date if not provided.

value_schema.description: The end of the date range over which you want to show schedule entries. Defaults to 2 weeks after since if a since is given. Optional parameter. When provided with include[] for schedule types, populates the rendered_schedule_entries fields in the response.

parameters.name: include_total_in_pagination
parameters.description: Set to true to populate the total field in pagination responses. Defaults to null for faster response times if false.
